items.abstract: <jats:p>We prove that if two normed-algebra-valued cosine families indexed by a single Abelian group, of which one is bounded and comprised solely of scalar elements of the underlying algebra, differ in norm by less than<jats:inline-formula><jats:alternatives><jats:inline-graphic xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" mime-subtype="gif" xlink:href="S1446788715000038_inline1" xlink:type="simple" /><jats:tex-math>$1$</jats:tex-math></jats:alternatives></jats:inline-formula>uniformly in the parametrising index, then these families coincide.</jats:p>
title: ON COSINE FAMILIES CLOSE TO SCALAR COSINE FAMILIES
